Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student may draw a plant, but the details might be very basic and lack differentiation between a plant with water and one without.
They might include a water source in the drawing, but it might not clearly connect to the plant's appearance. (e.g., a puddle or raindrop nearby without clear indication of its effect on the plant)
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to accurately depict the difference between a healthy plant with water and an unhealthy plant without water. (student may not understand what makes a plant appear healthy or wilted)
The student might not represent that plants need light in addition to water to live and grow. (may not be aware of the role of sunlight)
The drawing may not show patterns in nature regarding plants' appearance in different water conditions. (lacks awareness of the visual patterns associated with plant hydration)
